text: ਰਾਮਕਲੀ ਮਹਲਾ ੧ ਦਖਣੀ ਓਅੰਕਾਰੁ

translation.text: Raamkalee, First Mehl, Dakhanee, Ongkaar:

transliteration.text: rāmakalī mahalā 1 dakhanī ōankār

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ੴ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ॥

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

transliteration.text: ik ōunkār satigur prasād .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਓਅੰਕਾਰਿ ਬ੍ਰਹਮਾ ਉਤਪਤਿ ॥

translation.text: From Ongkaar, the One Universal Creator God, Brahma was created.

transliteration.text: ōankār brahamā utapat .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਓਅੰਕਾਰੁ ਕੀਆ ਜਿਨਿ ਚਿਤਿ ॥

translation.text: He kept Ongkaar in his consciousness.

transliteration.text: ōankār kīā jin chit .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

translation.text: From Ongkaar, the mountains and the ages were created.

transliteration.text: ōankār sail jug bhaē .

text: ਸੁਣਿ ਪਾਡੇ ਕਿਆ ਲਿਖਹੁ ਜੰਜਾਲਾ ॥

translation.text: Listen, O Pandit, O religious scholar, why are you writing about worldly debates?

transliteration.text: sun pādē kiā likhah janjālā .

translation.text: As Gurmukh, write only the Name of the Lord, the Lord of the World. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: likh rām nām guramukh gōpālā .1. rahāu .

translation.text: Sassa: He created the entire universe with ease; His One Light pervades the three worlds.

transliteration.text: sasai sabh jag sahaj upāiā tīn bhavan ik jōtī .

translation.text: Become Gurmukh, and obtain the real thing; gather the gems and pearls.

transliteration.text: guramukh vasat parāpat hōvai chun lai mānak mōtī .

translation.text: If one understands, realizes and comprehends what he reads and studies, in the end he shall realize that the True Lord dwells deep within his nucleus.

transliteration.text: samajhai sūjhai par par būjhai ant nirantar sāchā .

translation.text: The Gurmukh sees and contemplates the True Lord; without the True Lord, the world is false. ||2||

transliteration.text: guramukh dēkhai sāch samālē bin sāchē jag kāchā .2.

translation.text: Dhadha: Those who enshrine Dharmic faith and dwell in the City of Dharma are worthy; their minds are steadfast and stable.

transliteration.text: dhadhai dharam dharē dharamā pur gunakārī man dhīrā .

translation.text: Dhadha: If the dust of their feet touches one's face and forehead, he is transformed from iron into gold.

transliteration.text: dhadhai dhūl parai mukh masatak kanchan bhaē manūrā .

translation.text: Blessed is the Support of the Earth; He Himself is not born; His measure and speech are perfect and True.

transliteration.text: dhan dharanīdhar āp ajōnī tōl bōl sach pūrā .

translation.text: Only the Creator Himself knows His own extent; He alone knows the Brave Guru. ||3||

transliteration.text: karatē kī mit karatā jānai kai jānai gur sūrā .3.

text: ਙਿਆਨੁ ਗਵਾਇਆ ਦੂਜਾ ਭਾਇਆ ਗਰਬਿ ਗਲੇ ਬਿਖੁ ਖਾਇਆ ॥

translation.text: In love with duality, spiritual wisdom is lost; the mortal rots away in pride, and eats poison.

transliteration.text: niān gavāiā dūjā bhāiā garab galē bikh khāiā .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

text: ਗੁਰ ਰਸੁ ਗੀਤ ਬਾਦ ਨਹੀ ਭਾਵੈ ਸੁਣੀਐ ਗਹਿਰ ਗੰਭੀਰੁ ਗਵਾਇਆ ॥

translation.text: He thinks that the sublime essence of the Guru's song is useless, and he does not like to hear it. He loses the profound, unfathomable Lord.

transliteration.text: gur ras gīt bād nahī bhāvai sunīai gahir ganbhīr gavāiā .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

text: ਗੁਰਿ ਸਚੁ ਕਹਿਆ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤੁ ਲਹਿਆ ਮਨਿ ਤਨਿ ਸਾਚੁ ਸੁਖਾਇਆ ॥

translation.text: Through the Guru's Words of Truth, the Ambrosial Nectar is obtained, and the mind and body find joy in the True Lord.

transliteration.text: gur sach kahiā anmrit lahiā man tan sāch sukhāiā .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

text: ਆਪੇ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਆਪੇ ਦੇਵੈ ਆਪੇ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤੁ ਪੀਆਇਆ ॥੪॥

translation.text: He Himself is the Gurmukh, and He Himself bestows the Ambrosial Nectar; He Himself leads us to drink it in. ||4||

transliteration.text: āpē guramukh āpē dēvai āpē anmrit pīāiā .4.

translation.text: Everyone says that God is the One and only, but they are engrossed in egotism and pride.

transliteration.text: ēkō ēk kahai sabh kōī haumai garab viāpai .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

text: ਅੰਤਰਿ ਬਾਹਰਿ ਏਕੁ ਪਛਾਣੈ ਇਉ ਘਰੁ ਮਹਲੁ ਸਿਞਾਪੈ ॥

translation.text: Realize that the One God is inside and outside; understand this, that the Mansion of His Presence is within the home of your heart.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਓਹੁ ਬਿਧਾਤਾ ਮਨੁ ਤਨੁ ਦੇਇ ॥

translation.text: He is the Architect of Destiny; He blesses us with mind and body.

transliteration.text: ōh bidhātā man tan dēi .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਲਾਹਾ ਨਾਮੁ ਪੂੰਜੀ ਵੇਸਾਹੁ ॥

translation.text: One who earns the profit of the Naam, with the capital of faith,

transliteration.text: lāhā nām pūnjī vēsāh .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਚਿਤਿ ਵਸੈ ਰਾਚੈ ਹਰਿ ਨਾਇ ॥

translation.text: When the Lord dwells in the consciousness, and one is absorbed in the Lord's Name,

transliteration.text: chit vasai rāchai har nāi .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਆਪੇ ਸਮਝੈ ਆਪੇ ਸੂਝੈ ॥

translation.text: He Himself knows it, and He Himself comprehends it.

transliteration.text: āpē samajhai āpē sūjhai .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਡਰੁ ਰਾਖਿਆ ਗੁਰਿ ਆਪਣੈ ਨਿਰਭਉ ਨਾਮੁ ਵਖਾਣਿ ॥

translation.text: She maintains fear of her Guru, and chants the Name of the Fearless Lord.

transliteration.text: dar rākhiā gur āpanai nirabhau nām vakhān .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

text: ਡੂਗਰਿ ਵਾਸੁ ਤਿਖਾ ਘਣੀ ਜਬ ਦੇਖਾ ਨਹੀ ਦੂਰਿ ॥

translation.text: Living on the mountain, I suffer such great thirst; when I see Him, I know that He is not far away.

transliteration.text: dūgar vās tikhā ghanī jab dēkhā nahī dūr .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

text: ਤਿਖਾ ਨਿਵਾਰੀ ਸਬਦੁ ਮੰਨਿ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤੁ ਪੀਆ ਭਰਪੂਰਿ ॥

translation.text: My thirst is quenched, and I have accepted the Word of the Shabad. I drink my fill of the Ambrosial Nectar.

transliteration.text: tikhā nivārī sabad mann anmrit pīā bharapūr .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

translation.text: Everyone says, "Give! Give!" As He pleases, He gives.

transliteration.text: dēh dēh ākhai sabh kōī jai bhāvai tai dēi .

translation.text: Through the Gurdwara, the Guru's Door, He gives, and quenches the thirst. ||30||

transliteration.text: gurū duārai dēvasī tikhā nivārai sōi .30.

translation.text: Searching and seeking, I fell down and collapsed upon the bank of the river of life.

transliteration.text: dhandhōlat dhūdhat hau phirī dhah dhah pavan karār .

translation.text: Those who are heavy with sin sink down, but those who are light swim across.

transliteration.text: bhārē dhahatē dhah paē haulē nikasē pār .

translation.text: I am a sacrifice to those who meet the immortal and immeasurable Lord.

transliteration.text: amar ajāchī har milē tin kai hau bal jāu .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

translation.text: The dust of their feet brings emancipation; in their company, we are united in the Lord's Union.

transliteration.text: tin kī dhūr aghulīai sangat mēl milāu .

translation.text: By Guru's Grace, I contemplate Him, and then my body does not suffer in pain. ||31||

translation.text: No one is mine - whose gown should I grasp and hold? No one ever was, and no one shall ever be mine.

transliteration.text: nā kō mērā kis gahī nā kō hōā n hōg .

translation.text: Coming and going, one is ruined, afflicted with the disease of dual-mindedness.

transliteration.text: āvan jān viguchīai dubidhā viāpai rōg .

translation.text: Those beings who lack the Naam, the Name of the Lord, collapse like pillars of salt.

transliteration.text: nām vihūnē ādamī kalar kandh girant .

translation.text: Without the Name, how can they find release? They fall into hell in the end.

transliteration.text: vin nāvai kiu shūtīai jāi rasātal ant .

transliteration.text: ganat ganāvai akharī aganat sāchā sōi .

translation.text: The ignorant lack understanding. Without the Guru, there is no spiritual wisdom.

transliteration.text: agiānī matihīn hai gur bin giān n hōi .

translation.text: The separated soul is like the broken string of a guitar, which does not vibrate its sound.

transliteration.text: tūtī tant rabāb kī vājai nahī vijōg .

translation.text: They peck at the essence of reality, and merge with the One Lord. They are never trapped at all.

transliteration.text: tat chugah mil ēkasē tin kau phās n ranch .

translation.text: But the others fly away in a hurry, when they see the food.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਆਪੇ ਚਤੁਰੁ ਸਰੂਪੁ ਹੈ ਆਪੇ ਜਾਣੁ ਸੁਜਾਣੁ ॥੪੨॥

translation.text: He Himself is clever and so very beautiful; He Himself is wise and all-knowing. ||42||

transliteration.text: āpē chatur sarūp hai āpē jān sujān .42.

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

translation.text: Those who come, must go in the end; they come and go, regretting and repenting.

transliteration.text: jō āvah sē jāh phun āi gaē pashutāh .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

translation.text: They alone are saved, who love the Lord.

transliteration.text: sē jan ubarē jin har bhāiā .

translation.text: Whoever is seen, shall depart; who should I make my friend?

transliteration.text: jō dīsai sō chālasī kis kau mīt karēu .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

translation.text: You are eternally stable, O Creator, Lord and Master; I lean on Your Support.

transliteration.text: asathir karatā tū dhanī tis hī kī mai ōt .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

translation.text: Conquered by virtue, egotism is killed; imbued with the Word of the Shabad, the mind rejects the world. ||43||

transliteration.text: gun kī mārī hau muī sabad ratī man chōt .43.

transliteration.text: vārī āpō āpanī kōi n bandhai dhīr .

translation.text: The path is difficult and treacherous; the pools and mountains are impassable.

transliteration.text: rāh burā bhīhāvalā sar dūgar asagāh .

translation.text: My body is filled with faults; I am dying of grief. Without virtue, how can I enter my home?

transliteration.text: mai tan avagan jhur muī vin gun kiu ghar jāh .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

transliteration.text: gunīā gun lē prabh milē kiu tin milau piār .

translation.text: If ony I could be like them, chanting and meditating within my heart on the Lord.

transliteration.text: tin hī jaisī thī rahānh jap jap ridai murār .

translation.text: He is overflowing with faults and demerits, but virtue dwells within him as well.

translation.text: Without the True Guru, he does not see God's Virtues; he does not chant the Glorious Virtues of God. ||44||

translation.text: In the fortress of the body, they announce the victory of their Supreme King; they are never ever vanquished.

transliteration.text: gar dōhī pātisāh kī kadē n āvai hār .

transliteration.text: chākar kahīai khasam kā sauhē utar dēi .

text: ਆਪਿ ਕਰੇ ਕਿਸੁ ਆਖੀਐ ਅਵਰੁ ਨ ਕੋਇ ਕਰੇਇ ॥੪੫॥

translation.text: He Himself does everything; who else should we address? No one else does anything. ||45||

transliteration.text: āp karē kis ākhīai avar n kōi karēi .45.

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਬੀਜਉ ਸੂਝੈ ਕੋ ਨਹੀ ਬਹੈ ਦੁਲੀਚਾ ਪਾਇ ॥

translation.text: I cannot conceive of any other, who could be seated upon the royal cushions.

transliteration.text: bījau sūjhai kō nahī bahai dulīchā pāi .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

translation.text: The Supreme Man of men eradicates hell; He is True, and True is His Name.

transliteration.text: narak nivāran narah nar sāchau sāchai nāi .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

translation.text: I wandered around searching for Him in the forests and meadows; I contemplate Him within my mind.

transliteration.text: van trin dhūdhat phir rahī man mah karau bīchār .

translation.text: O Nanak, one who lovingly meets with his Beloved, earns profit in the world hereafter.

translation.text: As Gurmukh, meditate on the Infinite Lord, who has no end or limitation. ||46||

translation.text: He alone is the true banker, who has the capital of the wealth of the Lord.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਖਿਮਾ ਵਿਹੂਣੇ ਖਪਿ ਗਏ ਖੂਹਣਿ ਲਖ ਅਸੰਖ ॥

translation.text: Without patience and forgiveness, countless hundreds of thousands have perished.

transliteration.text: khimā vihūnē khap gaē khūhan lakh asankh .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

text: ਗਣਤ ਨ ਆਵੈ ਕਿਉ ਗਣੀ ਖਪਿ ਖਪਿ ਮੁਏ ਬਿਸੰਖ ॥

translation.text: Their numbers cannot be counted; how could I count them? Bothered and bewildered, uncounted numbers have died.

transliteration.text: ganat n āvai kiu ganī khap khap muē bisankh .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

translation.text: One who realizes his Lord and Master is set free, and not bound by chains.

transliteration.text: khasam pashānai āpanā khūlai bandh n pāi .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

translation.text: Through the Word of the Shabad, enter the Mansion of the Lord's Presence; you shall be blessed with patience, forgiveness, truth and peace.

transliteration.text: sabad mahalī kharā tū khimā sach sukh bhāi .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

transliteration.text: kharach kharā dhan dhiān tū āpē vasah sarīr .

transliteration.text: man tan mukh jāpai sadā gun antar man dhīr .

translation.text: Through egotism, one is distracted and ruined; other than the Lord, all things are corrupt.

transliteration.text: haumai khapai khapāisī bījau vath vikār .

translation.text: Forming His creatures, He placed Himself within them; the Creator is unattached and infinite. ||49||

transliteration.text: jant upāi vich pāian karatā alag apār .49.

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

transliteration.text: srisatē bhēu n jānai kōi .

translation.text: Seeing and perceiving, O my companions, I am wonder-struck and amazed.

translation.text: My egotism, which proclaimed itself in possessiveness and self-conceit, is dead. My mind chants the Word of the Shabad, and attains spiritual wisdom.

transliteration.text: hau hau karatī mai muī sabad ravai man giān .

translation.text: I am so tired of wearing all these necklaces, hair-ties and bracelets, and decorating myself.

translation.text: Meeting with my Beloved, I have found peace; now, I wear the necklace of total virtue.

transliteration.text: mil prītam sukh pāiā sagal gunā gal hār .

translation.text: O Nanak, the Gurmukh attains the Lord, with love and affection.

transliteration.text: nānak guramukh pāīai har siu prīt piār .

translation.text: Chant the Lord's Name, and meditate on the Lord; hold tight to the Support of the Name of the Lord. ||51||

author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਆਪੇ ਕਾਰਣੁ ਜਿਨਿ ਕੀਆ ਕਰਿ ਕਿਰਪਾ ਪਗੁ ਧਾਰਿ ॥

translation.text: He who created the universe, in His Mercy, installs His Feet within us.

transliteration.text: āpē kāran jin kīā kar kirapā pag dhār .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

text: ਕਰਤੇ ਹਥਿ ਵਡਿਆਈਆ ਬੂਝਹੁ ਗੁਰ ਬੀਚਾਰਿ ॥

translation.text: Glorious greatness rests in the Hands of the Creator; reflect upon the Guru, and understand this.

transliteration.text: karatē hath vadiāīā būjhah gur bīchār .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਲਿਖਿਆ ਫੇਰਿ ਨ ਸਕੀਐ ਜਿਉ ਭਾਵੀ ਤਿਉ ਸਾਰਿ ॥

translation.text: This inscription cannot be challenged. As it pleases You, You care for me.

transliteration.text: likhiā phēr n sakīai jiu bhāvī tiu sār .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

text: ਨਦਰਿ ਤੇਰੀ ਸੁਖੁ ਪਾਇਆ ਨਾਨਕ ਸਬਦੁ ਵੀਚਾਰਿ ॥

translation.text: By Your Glance of Grace, I have found peace; O Nanak, reflect upon the Shabad.

transliteration.text: nadar tērī sukh pāiā nānak sabad vīchār .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

text: ਮਨਮੁਖ ਭੂਲੇ ਪਚਿ ਮੁਏ ਉਬਰੇ ਗੁਰ ਬੀਚਾਰਿ ॥

translation.text: The self-willed manmukhs are confused; they rot away and die. Only by reflecting upon the Guru can they be saved.

transliteration.text: manamukh bhūlē pach muē ubarē gur bīchār .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਜਿ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਨਦਰਿ ਨ ਆਵਈ ਤਿਸ ਕਾ ਕਿਆ ਕਰਿ ਕਹਿਆ ਜਾਇ ॥

translation.text: What can anyone say, about that Primal Lord, who cannot be seen?

transliteration.text: j purakh nadar n āvaī tis kā kiā kar kahiā jāi .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

text: ਬਲਿਹਾਰੀ ਗੁਰ ਆਪਣੇ ਜਿਨਿ ਹਿਰਦੈ ਦਿਤਾ ਦਿਖਾਇ ॥੫੨॥

translation.text: I am a sacrifice to my Guru, who has revealed Him to me, within my own heart. ||52||

transliteration.text: balihārī gur āpanē jin hiradai ditā dikhāi .52.

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

text: ਪਾਧਾ ਪੜਿਆ ਆਖੀਐ ਬਿਦਿਆ ਬਿਚਰੈ ਸਹਜਿ ਸੁਭਾਇ ॥

translation.text: That Pandit, that religious scholar, is said to be well-educated, if he contemplates knowledge with intuitive ease.

transliteration.text: pādhā pariā ākhīai bidiā bicharai sahaj subhāi .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

text: ਬਿਦਿਆ ਸੋਧੈ ਤਤੁ ਲਹੈ ਰਾਮ ਨਾਮ ਲਿਵ ਲਾਇ ॥

translation.text: Considering his knowledge, he finds the essence of reality, and lovingly focuses his attention on the Name of the Lord.

transliteration.text: bidiā sōdhai tat lahai rām nām liv lāi .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

text: ਮਨਮੁਖੁ ਬਿਦਿਆ ਬਿਕ੍ਰਦਾ ਬਿਖੁ ਖਟੇ ਬਿਖੁ ਖਾਇ ॥

translation.text: The self-willed manmukh sells his knowledge; he earns poison, and eats poison.

transliteration.text: manamukh bidiā bikradā bikh khatē bikh khāi .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

text: ਮੂਰਖੁ ਸਬਦੁ ਨ ਚੀਨਈ ਸੂਝ ਬੂਝ ਨਹ ਕਾਇ ॥੫੩॥

translation.text: The fool does not think of the Word of the Shabad. He has no understanding, no comprehension. ||53||

transliteration.text: mūrakh sabad n chīnaī sūjh būjh nah kāi .53.

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

translation.text: That Pandit is called Gurmukh, who imparts understanding to his students.

transliteration.text: pādhā guramukh ākhīai chātariā mat dēi .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

text: ਨਾਮੁ ਸਮਾਲਹੁ ਨਾਮੁ ਸੰਗਰਹੁ ਲਾਹਾ ਜਗ ਮਹਿ ਲੇਇ ॥

translation.text: Contemplate the Naam, the Name of the Lord; gather in the Naam, and earn the true profit in this world.

transliteration.text: nām samālah nām sangarah lāhā jag mah lēi .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

translation.text: With the true notebook of the true mind, study the most sublime Word of the Shabad.

transliteration.text: sachī patī sach man parīai sabad s sār .

melody.description: The emotions created by Ramkali Dakhani are those of change from old to new and there is a surety that this alteration is advantageous. These feelings are highlighted and emphasised by the South Indian rhythm and style of expression.

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਸੋ ਪੜਿਆ ਸੋ ਪੰਡਿਤੁ ਬੀਨਾ ਜਿਸੁ ਰਾਮ ਨਾਮੁ ਗਲਿ ਹਾਰੁ ॥੫੪॥੧॥

translation.text: O Nanak, he alone is learned, and he alone is a wise Pandit, who wears the necklace of the Lord's Name. ||54||1||

transliteration.text: nānak sō pariā sō pandit bīnā jis rām nām gal hār .54.1.
